Title.En: Golden Triangle: Scope, Time and Cost in Project Management​

NoteLiteral.En:
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 
B2 level of English language proficiency is required.

Description.En: The importance of project management is constantly growing. Project management methodologies play a pivotal role in driving transformations across diverse domains, fostering innovation, and realizing strategic objectives.  Project success is measured by criteria such as scope, time, cost, quality and stakeholder satisfaction.  The project management golden triangle, a fundamental construct in this discipline, comprises three interlinked variables - scope, cost, and time - that collectively determine the project's quality. To achieve project success in various businesses and manage those three elements, the project manager must have a deep understanding of each element and where they have the opportunity to be flexible to accommodate changes throughout the project.

Title.En: Recognize projects and describe project scope

NoteLiteral.En: Having completed course, the student should be able to describe the project concept and project environment, apply various techniques to describe project requirements, develop works breakdown structure, project deliverables, outputs and outcomes.

Title.En: Apply project schedule and cost management tools

PrefLabel.En: organising, planning and scheduling work and activities

NoteLiteral.En: Having completed course, the student should be able to develop the project schedule, estimate project resources, establish project budget, apply various techniques of project schedule and cost management.

Title.En: Golden Triangle: Scope, Time and Cost in Project Management​
Golden Triangle: Scope, Time and Cost in Project Management​

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The expected workload of the micro-module is around 14 hours per week. This includes time invested in watching the video lectures, reading, preparation for quizzes, and assignment writing.  

Teaching and working methods: The micro-module utilizes digital teaching methods and applications which include video lectures, quizzes, case analysis, and assignment writing.  

The micro-module is examined by four mini quizzes and a project report. Project report is the final assessment. Project report consists of three practical tasks: Project scope, Project schedule and Project budget.  

This micro-module is PASS or FAIL. To pass the micro-module, you must achieve a score of 50% or higher for each graded activity. The highest possible grade is 100%. When you complete all the required micro-module activities, you will earn a final grade.

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M129&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)
Key tools and techniques for project success

The micro-module is intended for all students, regardless of background, who want to gain theoretical and practical knowledge on how to successfully manage the golden triangle of a project - scope, time and cost.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 

B2 level of English language proficiency is required.
